instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message:
Ok this one is a weird one
Customer brings in mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> states DVD got stuck into drive and thought it would be simple enough to take out drive and force stuck dvd out.

takes out DVD and now the computer doesnt recognize when ac adapter is plugged in and when you turn on via power button with charged battery it wont turn on unless you press power button long enough until it chimes. if you let go before chime it will shut down immediately.

im suspecting it to be SMC. did reflow didnt work. just wondering if there is a way to verify before replacing SMC

thanks in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message: they all look ok and measure fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message: Not possible, how are you measuring this? Not with any power applied I hope!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message:
no power.
red probe on ground and black on pin1 of each
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>: 0.5
<CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> 0.06

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message: I ask "over" the caps so each probe goes on one side of the cap. I need resistance and not diode mode set to 200 ohm scale.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message:
O. Ok. 

20 ohm and 115 ohm  Let me know if that makes more sense 
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message:
20 ohm for <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> makes sense, 115 ohm for <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> makes no sense. 

look at <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>. Add them all up. See how it should add up to 2.203 ohms?

See how your measurement is 115 ohms?

Figure out what's broken. It's a trace, via, or resistor somewhere in that "loop"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message:
yes i understand now how this works. ill check it out tomorrow morning. thats for the step by step. and thanks duke

i really need to come see you for private tutoring before my 23rd birthday...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message:
Also when you check the sense circuit, check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> too. If <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> is not good the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> will be dead too.
Check for shorts to GND on <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> and 7051 before replacing them, a shorted 6259 will kill the new resistor again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DVD stuck= Not recognizing ac adapter
threads.message: and if <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> is blown tell the customer to stop lying about using knockoff charger!
